comments.body: I don't understand that. Even `= default` *must* call the `TObject` constructor.

> I don't understand that. Even = default must call the TObject constructor.

It calls constructor, but before it set all members to 0

I see, so you're working around the compiler using it's freedom of us doing UB. It's not *really* the `=default` that forces this to happen; in principle the compiler could just do that for *any* object before calling its constructor...

So I think we're generally toast here. But I now understand how removing `=default` can avoid triggering this compiler optimization. Thanks for the explanation, @linev !
